results.title: The Adventures of Prince Achmed = Die abenteur des Prinzen Achmed
results.brief_description: Often hailed as the first full-length animation film in the history of cinema, this is also pioneering animator Lotte Reiniger’s most extraordinary work. Reiniger developed a highly sophisticated silhouette animation technique inspired by Chinese shadow theatre. Intricate hand-cut silhouettes were combined with shimmering backgrounds created with wax and sand set on back lit glass. Colour-tinting further enhanced the luminous effect. Amongst her collaborators were her husband Carl Koch, who acted as her production manager and photographer, and the filmmakers Walter Ruttman (Berlin, Symphony of a City) and Berthold Bartosch (L’idee) who created backgrounds and special effects. The story from the Arabian Nights allows full rein for Reiniger’s elaborate and ingenious work - magical-flying horse, wicked sorcerer, djinns, ogres, monsters and wondrous kingdoms abound. This version has been restored with a new recording of the original orchestral score. Intertitles with English subtitles.

results.title: The Adventures of Prince Achmed
results.brief_description: Based on stories from “The Arabian Nights.” A wicked sorcerer tricks Prince Achmed into riding a magical flying horse. The heroic prince is able to subdue the magical horse, which he uses to fly off to many adventures. While travelling, he falls in love with the beautiful Princess Peri Banu, and must defeat an army of demons to win her heart. The film is animated using the silhouette technique.

results.title: The Adventures of Pinocchio
results.creator_credit: Steve Barron, Jeffrey Sneller, Raju Patel, Dieter Gessler Filmproduktions, Davis Film and Video Production and Allied Pinocchio Prod
results.brief_description: This classic Italian story about Gepetto the carpenter who makes a wooden boy which he can love as a son. This production has wonderful computer animated special effects as the wooden “boy” becomes flesh. For those who loved the award winning Disney production, this version of the age-old story will delight all the family. Starring Martin Landau and Jonathan Taylor Thomas.

results.title: The Adventures of Peer Gynt
results.brief_description: A delightful puppet production based on the story by Ibsen and with music by Grieg. Peer Gynt enters a world filled with Trolls, Witches, Whirling Dervishes and the powerful Mountain King in the search for adventure and to get away from his nagging mother. Jim Gamble, master puppeteer introduces the story to a group of young children and then sweeps them away into a far-away fantasy land. However, things are not always what they seem.

results.title: The Adventures of Milo and Otis (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Masanori Hata, Satoru Ogata, Masaru Kakutani, Columbia Pictures and Fuji Television Network
results.brief_description: Join a curious kitten named Milo and his inseparable buddy, a pug-nosed pup named Otis, as they fall, frolic, glide and tumble through one exciting escapade after another. Narrated by Dudley Moore. Based on an original story by Masanori Hata.

results.title: The Adventures of Milo and Otis
results.creator_credit: Masanori Hata, Satoru Ogata, Masaru Kakutani, Columbia Pictures and Fuji Television Network
results.brief_description: Join a curious kitten named Milo and his inseparable buddy, a pug-nosed pup named Otis, as they fall, frolic, glide and tumble through one exciting escapade after another. Raised together on a friendly, sunny farm, Milo and Otis love to explore the countryside and tease the barnyard animals. But one day mischievous little Milo lets curiosity get the better of him and he’s suddenly swept down a rushing river in a wooden box. Taking off to rescue his best friend, Otis also leaves the safety of the farm behind him forever. What starts as an amusing and funny game soon turns into the most breathtaking, heartwrenching adventure of their lives … where love and friendship are the most wonderful gifts of all. Based on an original story by Masanori Hata. Narrated by Dudley Moore.

results.title: The Adventures of Mary-Kate & Ashley
results.brief_description: Mystery, action and songs abound as Detectives Mary-Kate and Ashley undertake a set of daring advetures. These trenchcoat twins and their dog Clue live by their agency motto to “solve any crime by dinner time.”

results.title: The Adventures of Marco Polo
results.creator_credit: Archie Mayo, Samuel Goldwyn and Samuel Goldwyn Productions
results.brief_description: Gary Cooper stars as 13th Century explorer and adventurer Marco Polo, the Venetian who opened the trade route from Europe to China. At the court of the great Kublai Khan, ruler of the Mongol Empire, Marco battles the intrigue of the court to win the admiration of the great Khan and the love of a beautiful Princess (Sigrid Guthrie). A classic historical drama filled with spectacular battle scenes, panoramas, opulent sets and costumes. Co-starring Basil Rathbone.

results.title: The Adventures of Huck Finn
results.creator_credit: Stephen Sommers, Laurence Mark and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Film adaptation of the classic 19th century novel ‘The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn’ by American writer, Mark Twain. This is a story about Huck Finn (Elijah Wood), a poor uneducated boy who has run away from home to escape his abusive drunken father, and Huck’s chance encounter with Jim (Courtney S. Vance), an escaped slave. Together the two follow the Mississippi River finding adventure and drama and some rather dubious characters by the names of the King (Jason Robards) and the Duke (Robbie Coltrane). Cast also includes Ron Perlman and Laura Bundy.

results.title: The Adventures of Handyman
results.creator_credit: Martin Murphy, Craig Salvin and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A suburban damsel in distress with a blocked sink heralds the arrival of Handyman - mild mannered and silver haired Reg O’Grady who proves that super heroes don’t have a shelf life.
